verses.verse: The word<WH1697> of the LORD<WH3068> which<WH834> came<WH1961> to Jeremiah<WH3414> the prophet<WH5030> against<WH5921> the Gentiles;<WH1471>

Against Egypt,<WH4714> against<WH5921> the army<WH2428> of Pharaohnecho<WH6549> king<WH4428> of Egypt,<WH4714> which<WH834> was by the river<WH5104> Euphrates<WH6578> in Carchemish,<WH3751> which<WH834> Nebuchadrezzar<WH5019> king<WH4428> of Babylon<WH894> smote<WH5221> in the fourth<WH7243> year<WH8141> of Jehoiakim<WH3079> the son<WH1121> of Josiah<WH2977> king<WH4428> of Judah.<WH3063>
Order<WH6186> you the buckler<WH4043> and shield,<WH6793> and draw near<WH5066> to battle.<WH4421>

Harness<WH631> the horses;<WH5483> and get<WH5927> up, you horsemen,<WH6571> and stand<WH3320> forth with your helmets;<WH3553> furbish<WH4838> the spears,<WH7420> and put<WH3847> on the brigandines.<WH5630>

Why<WH4069> have I seen<WH7200> them dismayed<WH2844> and turned<WH5472> away back?<WH268> and their mighty<WH1368> ones are beaten<WH3807> down, and are fled<WH5127> apace, and look<WH6437> not back:<WH3437> for fear<WH4032> was round<WH5439> about, said<WH5002> the LORD.<WH3068>

Let not the swift<WH7031> flee<WH5127> away, nor<WH408> the mighty<WH1368> man escape;<WH4422> they shall stumble,<WH3782> and fall<WH5307> toward the north<WH6828> by the river<WH5104> Euphrates.<WH6578>
Who<WH4310> is this<WH2088> that comes<WH5927> up as a flood,<WH2975> whose waters<WH4325> are moved<WH1607> as the rivers?<WH5104>

Egypt<WH4714> rises<WH5927> up like a flood,<WH2975> and his waters<WH4325> are moved<WH1607> like the rivers;<WH5104> and he said,<WH559> I will go<WH5927> up, and will cover<WH3680> the earth;<WH776> I will destroy<WH6> the city<WH5892> and the inhabitants<WH3427> thereof.

Come<WH5927> up, you horses;<WH5483> and rage,<WH1984> you chariots;<WH7393> and let the mighty<WH1368> men come<WH3318> forth;<WH3318> the Ethiopians<WH3569> and the Libyans,<WH6316> that handle<WH8610> the shield;<WH4043> and the Lydians,<WH3866> that handle<WH8610> and bend<WH1869> the bow.<WH7198>

For this<WH1931> is the day<WH3117> of the Lord<WH136> GOD<WH3069> of hosts,<WH6635> a day<WH3117> of vengeance,<WH5360> that he may avenge<WH5358> him of his adversaries:<WH6862> and the sword<WH2719> shall devour,<WH398> and it shall be satiate<WH7646> and made drunk<WH7301> with their blood:<WH1818> for the Lord<WH136> GOD<WH3069> of hosts<WH6635> has a sacrifice<WH2077> in the north<WH6828> country<WH776> by the river<WH5104> Euphrates.<WH6578>

Go<WH5927> up into Gilead,<WH1568> and take<WH3947> balm,<WH6875> O virgin,<WH1330> the daughter<WH1323> of Egypt:<WH4714> in vain<WH7723> shall you use many<WH7235> medicines;<WH7499> for you shall not be cured.<WH8585>

The nations<WH1471> have heard<WH8085> of your shame,<WH7036> and your cry<WH6682> has filled<WH4390> the land:<WH776> for the mighty<WH1368> man has stumbled<WH3782> against the mighty,<WH1368> and they are fallen<WH5307> both<WH8147> together.<WH3162>

The word<WH1697> that the LORD<WH3068> spoke<WH1696> to Jeremiah<WH3414> the prophet,<WH5030> how Nebuchadrezzar<WH5019> king<WH4428> of Babylon<WH894> should come<WH935> and smite<WH5221> the land<WH776> of Egypt.<WH4714>

Declare<WH5046> you in Egypt,<WH4714> and publish<WH8085> in Migdol,<WH4024> and publish<WH8085> in Noph<WH5297> and in Tahpanhes:<WH8471> say<WH559> you, Stand<WH3320> fast, and prepare<WH3559> you; for the sword<WH2719> shall devour<WH398> round<WH5439> about you.
Why<WH4069> are your valiant<WH47> men swept<WH5502> away? they stood<WH5975> not, because<WH3588> the LORD<WH3068> did drive<WH1920> them.

He made many<WH7235> to fall,<WH3782> yes, one<WH376> fell<WH5307> on another:<WH7453> and they said,<WH559> Arise,<WH6965> and let us go<WH7725> again<WH7725> to our own people,<WH5971> and to the land<WH776> of our nativity,<WH4138> from the oppressing<WH3238> sword.<WH2719>
They did cry<WH7121> there,<WH8033> Pharaoh<WH6547> king<WH4428> of Egypt<WH4714> is but a noise;<WH7588> he has passed<WH5674> the time appointed.<WH4150>

As I live,<WH2416> said<WH5002> the King,<WH4428> whose name<WH8034> is the LORD<WH3068> of hosts,<WH6635> Surely<WH3588> as Tabor<WH8396> is among the mountains,<WH2022> and as Carmel<WH3760> by the sea,<WH3220> so shall he come.<WH935>

O you daughter<WH1323> dwelling<WH3427> in Egypt,<WH4714> furnish<WH6213> <WH3627> yourself to go into captivity:<WH1473> for Noph<WH5297> shall be waste<WH8047> and desolate<WH3341> without<WH369> an inhabitant.<WH3427>
Egypt<WH4714> is like a very<WH3304> fair<WH3304> heifer,<WH5697> but destruction<WH7171> comes;<WH935> it comes<WH935> out of the north.<WH6828>

Also<WH1571> her hired<WH7916> men are in the middle<WH7130> of her like fatted<WH4770> bullocks;<WH5695> for they also<WH1571> are turned<WH6437> back,<WH3437> and are fled<WH5127> away together:<WH3162> they did not stand,<WH5975> because<WH3588> the day<WH3117> of their calamity<WH343> was come<WH935> on them, and the time<WH6256> of their visitation.<WH6486>
The voice<WH6963> thereof shall go<WH3212> like a serpent;<WH5175> for they shall march<WH3212> with an army,<WH2428> and come<WH935> against her with axes,<WH7134> as hewers<WH2404> of wood.<WH6086>

They shall cut<WH3772> down her forest,<WH3293> said<WH5002> the LORD,<WH3068> though<WH3588> it cannot<WH3808> be searched;<WH2713> because<WH3588> they are more<WH7231> than the grasshoppers,<WH697> and are innumerable.<WH369> <WH4557>
The daughter<WH1323> of Egypt<WH4714> shall be confounded;<WH3001> she shall be delivered<WH5414> into the hand<WH3027> of the people<WH5971> of the north.<WH6828>

The LORD<WH3068> of hosts,<WH6635> the God<WH430> of Israel,<WH3478> said;<WH559> Behold,<WH2005> I will punish<WH6485> the multitude<WH527> of No,<WH4996> and Pharaoh,<WH6547> and Egypt,<WH4714> with their gods,<WH430> and their kings;<WH4428> even Pharaoh,<WH6547> and all them that trust<WH982> in him:

And I will deliver<WH5414> them into the hand<WH3027> of those that seek<WH1245> their lives,<WH5315> and into the hand<WH3027> of Nebuchadrezzar<WH5019> king<WH4428> of Babylon,<WH894> and into the hand<WH3027> of his servants:<WH5650> and afterward<WH310> <WH3651> it shall be inhabited,<WH7931> as in the days<WH3117> of old,<WH6924> said<WH5002> the LORD.<WH3068>

But fear<WH3372> not you, O my servant<WH5650> Jacob,<WH3290> and be not dismayed,<WH2865> O Israel:<WH3478> for, behold,<WH2005> I will save<WH3467> you from afar<WH7350> off, and your seed<WH2233> from the land<WH776> of their captivity;<WH7633> and Jacob<WH3290> shall return,<WH7725> and be in rest<WH8252> and at ease,<WH7599> and none<WH369> shall make him afraid.<WH2729>

Fear<WH3372> you not, O Jacob<WH3290> my servant,<WH5650> said<WH5002> the LORD:<WH3068> for I am with you; for I will make<WH6213> a full end<WH3615> of all<WH3605> the nations<WH1471> where<WH834> <WH8033> I have driven<WH5080> you: but I will not make<WH6213> a full end<WH3615> of you, but correct<WH3256> you in measure;<WH4941> yet will I not leave you wholly<WH5352> unpunished.<WH5352>
